questions.question: 2 colonial powers fought each other for control of N. America during the French & Indian War

choices.answer: Great Britain & Native Americans
Great Britain & France
France & Native Americans
France & Spain

questions.question: In what way did the French & Indian War impact GA?

choices.answer: Devastated much of the colony due to the fierce battles
No effect because the battles took place in the north
Added territory to the colony; increased security by Britain
Enraged Georgians because colony became smaller

questions.question: What divided Florida, expanded GA's territory, & angered colonist who wanted to settle west?

choices.answer: Treaty of Versailles
Charter of 1732
Stamp Act
Proclamation of 1763

questions.question: Loyalists can best be described as

choices.answer: Colonist who support independence.
Colonists who support the king.
Colonists who didn't care about the war
Patriots who used violence to keep people from buying stamps

questions.question: What punished colonists for rebellious activities like the Boston Tea Party?

choices.answer: Intolerable Acts
Stamp Act
Sugar Act
Tea Act

questions.question: How did Patriots respond to the Stamp Act & Intolerable Acts?

choices.answer: They refused to ratify the Constitution
They were upset; chose delegates to the Continental Congress
They were angered & made their protests known.
They supported them because of strong ties to England.

questions.question: Georgia was

choices.answer: 1st colony to call for rebellion against British
1st colony to send delegates to Continental Congress
Slower than most colonies to break with England
Only colony not to sign Declaration of Independence

questions.question: Why were the other 12 colonies upset with GA before July 1775?

choices.answer: They thought GA responsible for Intolerable Acts.
No Georgian would sign Declaration of Independence.
GA did not seem very supportive of the revolutionary cause.
Georgia was the only colony supporting slave trade.

questions.question: GA was more hesitant than the other colonies to break with Great Britain because

choices.answer: GA had been attacked by other British colonies.
Colony was dependent on Great Britain for protection.
most people supported the Intolerable Acts.
Georgians liked King George & thought laws were fair.

questions.question: Why was GA no longer considered a British royal colony in 1776?

choices.answer: France took control of the colony.
It became a Trust in that year.
Spain began to rule it that year.
It declared independence from Great Britain.

questions.question: What was significant about Lyman Hall, Button Gwinnett, & George Walton?

choices.answer: They went to Philadelphia for 2nd Continental Congress.
They represented GA at 1st Continental Congress.
They signed the Stamp Act on behalf of GA.
They signed the Declaration of Independence for GA.

questions.question: How did Georgia’s representatives to the Constitutional Convention feel about the slave trade?

choices.answer: Supported it because GA needed slaves
Hated it because it violated people's freedoms
Did not care because they were not slave owners
Upset that there was no slave trade

questions.question: Who helped write Articles of Confederation, elected to GA’s patriot assembly, & died in a duel?

choices.answer: Elijah Clarke
Austin Dabney
Lyman Hall
Button Gwinnet

questions.question: In what year was Georgia’s first constitution adopted?
Which of the following is true regarding Georgia’s Constitution of 1777?

choices.answer: Made colonists nervous because governor had too much power
People didn't trust governor; gave assembly most power
Did away with counties & combined GA into one state
Repealed once Declaration of Independence was signed

questions.question: What Revolutionary War battle broke the British stronghold in Georgia?

choices.answer: Siege of Savannah
Battle of Britain
Battle of Chickamauga
Battle of Kettle Creek

questions.question: Led GA Patriots to victory at Kettle Creek, retook Augusta in 1781, & fought Native Americans

choices.answer: Elijah Clarke
Austin Dabney
George Washington
Nancy Hart

questions.question: What was special about Austin Dabney?

choices.answer: Slave who won freedom for brave service in the war
Led a heroic attack during Siege of Savannah
Captured several British leaders despite being wounded
Commanded Patriot troops who won victory at Kettle Creek

questions.question: Who was Nancy Hart?

choices.answer: Loyalist who had to leave GA after the war
Used her beauty to spy on British soldiers
Shy wife of famous Patriot officer
Brave Patriot who captured British soldiers

questions.question: Elijah Clarke’s victory at Kettle Creek

choices.answer: boosted morale of patriots
stopped Union's 1st attempt to invade GA in Civil War
led to end of Native American resistance to removal
allowed Lord Cornwallis to invade NC during revolution

questions.question: Which of the following best describes how the American Revolution was fought in Georgia?

choices.answer: Little violence because most fighting was north of Virginia
Slaves & women played no role in fighting
Colonists & British soldiers fought after the war began
Fighting was bloody & bitter; fighters were GA colonists

questions.question: There was much debate at the Constitutional Convention over which of the following issues?

choices.answer: Number of representatives each state should have in Congress
Best way to end slavery
Whether or not to end slavery
How to change state governments

questions.question: Why did federal government experience financial problems under the Articles of Confederation?

choices.answer: U.S. did not have enough natural resources to make money.
Congress lacked power to tax U.S. citizens
President & Congress stole from the U.S. Treasury.
It didn't give states enough money.

questions.question: What document was created in an attempt to revise the Articles of Confederation?

choices.answer: GA Constitution of 1777
U.S. Constitution
Bill of Rights
Declaration of Independence

questions.question: GA statesman at Continental Congress, helped adopt U.S. Constitution, & was Georgia delegate

choices.answer: Lyman Hall
Abraham Baldwin
Elijah Clarke
Button Gwinnett

questions.question: Georgia was one of the first states to ratify the U.S. Constitution because

choices.answer: Needed central government for military protection & trade
Needed to show the other states it was devoted to government
Most Georgians did not want strong central government
GA merchants didn't want to establish overseas trade

questions.question: How did most Georgians feel about the Constitution?

choices.answer: Most against it because president had too much power
Most didn't care; too busy fighting Creek Indians
Supported it b/c thought GA needed government to be strong
Most against it b/c they didn't want powerful legislature

questions.question: Abraham Baldwin & what other GA represented the state at Constitutional Convention of 1787?

choices.answer: William Few
Nancy Hart
George Walton
Austin Dabney

questions.question: The U.S. Bill of Rights

choices.answer: consists of 10 amendments to the Constitution.
had to be added to the Constitution before GA would ratify.
was opposed by people who believed in personal freedoms.
was the 1st part of the U.S. Constitution written.
